# I Wan'na Be like You (The Monkey Song)

From Wikipedia, the free encyclopedia

Jump to navigation Jump to search

[![](//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/en/thumb/9/99/Question_book-new.svg/50px-Question_book-new.svg.png)](/wiki/File:Question_book-new.svg) |  This article **needs additional citations for[verification](/wiki/Wikipedia:Verifiability "Wikipedia:Verifiability")**. Please help [improve this article](//en.wikipedia.org/w/index.php?title=I_Wan%27na_Be_like_You_\(The_Monkey_Song\)&action=edit) by [adding citations to reliable sources](/wiki/Help:Introduction_to_referencing_with_Wiki_Markup/1 "Help:Introduction to referencing with Wiki Markup/1"). "**I Wan 'na Be like You**" is a song from [Walt Disney](/wiki/Walt_Disney
"Walt Disney")'s 1967 film _[The Jungle
Book](/wiki/The_Jungle_Book_\(1967_film\) "The Jungle Book \(1967 film\)")_.
The song was written by songwriters [Robert and Richard
Sherman](/wiki/Sherman_Brothers "Sherman Brothers") and was performed by
[Louis Prima](/wiki/Louis_Prima "Louis Prima").[1]

[Richard Sherman](/wiki/Richard_M._Sherman "Richard M. Sherman") said he and
his brother aimed for a [jazz](/wiki/Jazz "Jazz") sound, with a
[Dixieland](/wiki/Dixieland "Dixieland")-like melody. He added that "When we
first got an idea for 'I Wan'na Be Like You,' we said an ape swings from a
tree, and he's the king of apes. We'll make him 'the king of the
[swingers](/wiki/Swing_\(dance\) "Swing \(dance\)").' That's the idea, we'll
make him a jazz man." Once Prima was invited to do the song, he mockingly
responded to the Shermans with "You want [to make a monkey out of
me](https://en.wiktionary.org/wiki/make_a_monkey_out_of "wikt:make a monkey
out of")? You got me!" The instrumentals were originally recorded by Prima—who
also played the trumpet—and his band, [Sam Butera](/wiki/Sam_Butera "Sam
Butera") & The Witnesses, but the music was replaced by one written by the
film's composer, [George Bruns](/wiki/George_Bruns "George Bruns"), and
orchestrated by Walter Sheets. The "[scat](/wiki/Scat_singing "Scat singing")
dialogue" between Baloo and King Louie was the result of two recording
sessions. Louis Prima recorded first, with the intent that Baloo—played in his
recording by Butera—would simply repeat what Louie scatted, but [Phil
Harris](/wiki/Phil_Harris "Phil Harris") decided not to imitate Prima's
recording and made up his own. The song was released the same date as the
motion picture itself.[2][3]

## Cover
versions[[edit](/w/index.php?title=I_Wan%27na_Be_like_You_\(The_Monkey_Song\)&action=edit&section=1
"Edit section: Cover versions")]

  * [Kenny Ball](/wiki/Kenny_Ball "Kenny Ball") and His Jazzmen released a single of "I Wanna Be like You" (without an apostrophe in the title) in 1968[4] and it also featured on their 1969 album _King of the Swingers_.[5]
  * [Pinky and Perky](/wiki/Pinky_and_Perky "Pinky and Perky") recorded a version for their _Film Parade_ album in 1970 and also released the song as a single.
  * On the 1990 collection _[Stay Awake: Various Interpretations of Music from Vintage Disney Films](/wiki/Stay_Awake:_Various_Interpretations_of_Music_from_Vintage_Disney_Films "Stay Awake: Various Interpretations of Music from Vintage Disney Films")_ , the song appears on "Medley Two" as recorded by [Los Lobos](/wiki/Los_Lobos "Los Lobos"), who play the song occasionally in their live shows.
  * On 5 April 1994 [Phish](/wiki/Phish "Phish") performed a truly Phish-styled version at The Metropolis Concert Hall in [Montreal](/wiki/Montreal "Montreal"), [Quebec](/wiki/Quebec "Quebec").
  * [Big Bad Voodoo Daddy](/wiki/Big_Bad_Voodoo_Daddy "Big Bad Voodoo Daddy") did a cover of the song on the _[Swingers](/wiki/Swingers_\(1996_film\) "Swingers \(1996 film\)")_ soundtrack, even though the song does not appear in the film. The band later released the song on their 1999 album _[This Beautiful Life](/wiki/This_Beautiful_Life "This Beautiful Life")_.
  * [Voodoo Glow Skulls](/wiki/Voodoo_Glow_Skulls "Voodoo Glow Skulls") recorded a [ska](/wiki/Ska "Ska") version of the song for the 2002 Japanese-exclusive album _[Dive into Disney](/wiki/Dive_into_Disney "Dive into Disney")_.
  * _[The Jungle Book 2](/wiki/The_Jungle_Book_2 "The Jungle Book 2")_ , released in 2003, featured the band [Smash Mouth](/wiki/Smash_Mouth "Smash Mouth") playing the song during the end credits of the film; the song also appeared on the film's soundtrack. In the Australian version, [Nikki Webster](/wiki/Nikki_Webster "Nikki Webster") covers the song, which is also featured on her _[Best of](/wiki/The_Best_of_Nikki_Webster "The Best of Nikki Webster")_ album.
  * The 2005 album _En Vivo_ by [Gabriel Ríos](/wiki/Gabriel_R%C3%ADos "Gabriel Ríos") contains a cover of the song.
  * In 2007, a [pop rock](/wiki/Pop_rock "Pop rock") cover was recorded by the [Jonas Brothers](/wiki/Jonas_Brothers "Jonas Brothers") for _[Disneymania 5](/wiki/Disneymania_5 "Disneymania 5")_.
  * British pop singer [Paolo Nutini](/wiki/Paolo_Nutini "Paolo Nutini") performed "I Wan'na Be like You" at the 2007 [Glastonbury Festival](/wiki/Glastonbury_Festival "Glastonbury Festival").
  * On 23 October 2010, _[X Factor](/wiki/The_X_Factor_\(UK_TV_series\) "The X Factor \(UK TV series\)")_ contestant [Katie Waissel](/wiki/Katie_Waissel "Katie Waissel") pleased the judges with her surprise selection of the song.
  * [Craig David](/wiki/Craig_David "Craig David") sang a cover of the song for an award ceremony in the UK; the video is on [YouTube](/wiki/YouTube "YouTube").
  * In November 2013, [The Overtones](/wiki/The_Overtones "The Overtones") recorded a cover of the song as a mix with "[The Bare Necessities](/wiki/The_Bare_Necessities "The Bare Necessities")" for their album _Saturday Night at the Movies_.
  * In 2015, [Fall Out Boy](/wiki/Fall_Out_Boy "Fall Out Boy") recorded a cover version of the song for the compilation album _[We Love Disney](/wiki/We_Love_Disney_\(2015_album\) "We Love Disney \(2015 album\)")_.
  * [Christopher Walken](/wiki/Christopher_Walken "Christopher Walken") performs the song as King Louie in the [2016 live-action adaptation](/wiki/The_Jungle_Book_\(2016_film\) "The Jungle Book \(2016 film\)"), with new lyrics written by Richard M. Sherman to reflect the character of Louie being depicted as a [Gigantopithecus](/wiki/Gigantopithecus "Gigantopithecus").[6]
  * [J-pop](/wiki/J-pop "J-pop") band Little Glee Monster recorded a Japanese cover of the song titled 'Kimi no yō ni naritai` (君のようになりたい).
  * The Fun Songs version is performed in a 1994 Disney Sing-Along Songs home video: _Let 's Go to the Circus_. In it, Toby Scott Ganger imagines what it would be like if he and his friends were all monkeys in the [Ringling Bros. and Barnum & Bailey Circus](/wiki/Ringling_Bros._and_Barnum_%26_Bailey_Circus "Ringling Bros. and Barnum & Bailey Circus") show.

"I Wan'na Be like You" was covered by British recording artist [Robbie
Williams](/wiki/Robbie_Williams "Robbie Williams") featuring British recording
artist [Olly Murs](/wiki/Olly_Murs "Olly Murs") for his tenth studio album
_[Swings Both Ways](/wiki/Swings_Both_Ways "Swings Both Ways")_ (2013).
Production of their rendition was handled by [Guy Chambers](/wiki/Guy_Chambers
"Guy Chambers"). However, in the liner notes Robbie Williams incorrectly
attributes the original to Phil Harris, and says how much he admires Harris
(p. 4 of notes in Deluxe Edition).

## Uses in popular
culture[[edit](/w/index.php?title=I_Wan%27na_Be_like_You_\(The_Monkey_Song\)&action=edit&section=4
"Edit section: Uses in popular culture")]

  * In 2009, "I Wanna Be like You" was used in a British anti-smoking [public information film](/wiki/Public_information_film "Public information film"). It showed children copying everything their parents did (for example, boys putting shaving cream on their faces, girls dressing up in their mothers' best clothes and both genders washing the car), and "I Wanna Be like You" is playing throughout the advertisement, but it stops when a girl puts a crayon to her mouth in imitation of her mother smoking. It stops with the voice-over saying, "If you smoke, your children are more likely to."
  * The Robbie Williams/Olly Murs collaborative cover appears in season 3, episode 9 of the TV drama _[Stella](/wiki/Stella_\(UK_TV_series\) "Stella \(UK TV series\)")_.
  * In 2015, "I Wanna Be like You" was featured in season 1, episode 7 of the TV drama _[Aquarius](/wiki/Aquarius_\(U.S._TV_series\) "Aquarius \(U.S. TV series\)")_.
